But before we get too far ahead of ourselves, we understand that God is working personally in Genesis chapter 42. I wonder this evening, as we look at this portion of Scripture and we see the dialogue, we see the account, the events as they unfold on this first visit to Egypt. So much more than what these 10 brothers expected. I don't think for a moment they were thinking God was going to convict them, deal with them in this manner. But I wonder as I look at this portion of Scripture, I'm amazed by the sensitivity of them recognizing that God was at work. Think about it this way with me. Sometimes we deal with circumstances and situations and we say, well, it's just bad luck, just misfortune, just this thing happened. You know, these boys, I don't think they were very close to God, but you know their immediate response? God is at work. What is this that God hath done unto us? I wonder tonight, how quick are we to acknowledge God working in our lives? When that circumstance, whatever it might be, when this thing happens in your life and in my life, we know, listen, we know that God is sovereign. We know that God is a pursuing God. God is an intimate, personal God. We can stand here and say, I want to be right with God. God wants you to be right with Him more than you could ever want to be right with God. I believe that with all my heart tonight. Draw an eye unto God and He'll draw an eye unto you. Amen? And I wonder tonight when that thing happens in my life and in your life, do we recognize it as being the hand of God? Do we examine our lives and say, what is God trying to teach me through this? How is God trying to grow me through this? this? How's God going to use me through this? Or do we just write it off as some kind of bad misfortune, bad luck, whatever word we want to use to just kind of again continue to suppress something? You understand what I'm saying tonight? These boys, God is at work. What has God done to us? And I just wonder tonight, how's God working in our lives? Do you see God working in your life? Do you hear the voice of God when you read the Bible, when you come to church, when you hear the preaching of God's word? Is God working in your life? Are there some things that God's putting his finger on? And maybe we don't like it. Maybe we don't want to deal with it. But God's at work. And God's going to continue to pursue. God's going to continue to pursue. And God wants you to not have a hard heart, but to have a tender heart. He doesn't want us to be hardened, but to be softened, to be tender. And this evening, as we look at Genesis chapter 42, we see how God is working in the life of Joseph, the life of the brothers, the life of Jacob. I just believe tonight that God's working in our lives as well. And I wonder, are we able to recognize it? And how do we respond to it? What is God doing? How is God working? Will we let God be God and have his way? Let's pray together. Father, we love you. We thank you for loving us. God, we thank you for this portion of Scripture, for the opportunity to see how you're a personal God. Lord, I pray that in the quietness of the moment tonight, as we've heard the preaching of your word, as we have a time of invitation even in preparation for observing the Lord's Supper, God, I pray that you'd help us to examine ourselves. God, I pray that you'd help us to submit, to surrender to thee. Lord, I don't know how you're working in everyone's life. I believe that you are at work. And I know at times it's uncomfortable, it's difficult. But God, I pray that you'd help us to submit and surrender. God, we would see and acknowledge that you are at work. Would you have your will and way in these moments of invitation? Well, thank you for what you'll do. For it's in Christ's name we pray.
